business.headline: Hyundai IPO: GMP rises marginally, should you subscribe? Hyundai Motors India IPO: The share price has been set between Rs 1,865 and Rs 1,960 per share. With this IPO, Hyundai aims to raise a massive Rs 27,856 crore, making it the largest public offering in India's history.

No spectrum auction: Government after Elon Musk objects to Mukesh Ambani's pitchTelecom Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia has announced that India will follow the global trend of administrative spectrum allocation. The decision came after Starlink CEO Elon Musk objected to Ambani's Reliance Jio lobbying for the auction route.

DA hike update: Central government employees can expect big Diwali giftThe expected hike in DA would mean that over 1 crore central government employees and pensioners will receive their October salaries with the new DA rate, along with three months' worth of arrears.
LIC Mutual Fund reduces daily minimum SIP limit to Rs 100Investors can now begin a SIP with just Rs 100 and in multiples of Re 1 thereafter for select schemes of LIC Mutual Fund (LIC MF).

Garuda Construction and Engineering listing: Book profit or hold?Garuda Construction and Engineering listing: Despite a sluggish outlook in the grey market, which had indicated a flat or negative listing, the company surprised many with its strong opening.

Garuda Construction and Engineering shares list at 10.5% premium at Rs 105Garuda Construction and Engineering IPO listing: The company's market debut has exceeded expectations, particularly given the flat to negative outlook in the grey market before the listing.

Nvidia inches closer to overtaking Apple as world's most valuable companyNvidia share price: The latest stock jump pushed Nvidia's market value to $3.39 trillion, just shy of Apple's $3.52 trillion, but ahead of Microsoft's $3.12 trillion.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Omar Abdullah takes oath as J&K Chief Minister, Surinder Choudhary his deputyNational Conference leader Omar Abdullah on Wednesday was sworn-in as the Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister as the Union Territory got its first government after six years.

Complete defiance: Supreme Court blasts Punjab, Haryana over Delhi air pollutionThe Supreme Court directed the Commission of Air Quality Management to take penal action against state government officers and directed the Haryana Chief Secretary to be present in court next Wednesday.

How S Jaishankar started his day in Islamabad ahead of SCO SummitExternal Affairs Minister S Jaishankar, who is in Pakistan for the SCO Summit, began his day with a morning walk with Indian diplomats and planting a sapling at the Indian High Commission in Islamabad.

Canadian Sikh MP wants sanctions on Indian diplomats, gets mocked by journalistsAmid the escalating India-Canada diplomatic row, Canadian Sikh leader Jagmeet Singh was mocked by journalists at a press conference when he demanded "severe sanctions" on Indian diplomats.

Imran Khan isolated in dark cell, no calls to sons, jail cook on leave: Ex-wifeJemima Goldsmith's allegations against the Pakistan government come amid the ongoing two-day SCO Summit in Islamabad, which has drawn top leaders from member states and turned the capital city into a fortress.

Canada's charges serious: Five Eyes allies US, New Zealand on its row with IndiaUS State Department spokesperson Matthew Miller said Canada's allegations against India in the killing of Hardeep Singh Nijjar "need to be taken seriously".

Singapore scrambled fighter jets after bomb threat on Air India Express flightSingapore Defence Minister Ng Eng Hen said that the two RSAF F-15SG jets escorted the Air India Express flight away from populated areas before it landed at the Changi Airport.

Shiv Aroor explainsCanada's Foreign Minister Mélanie Joly has suggested that "everything is on the table" when asked if Ottawa would consider imposing sanctions on India. If Canada imposes sanctions on India, New Delhi has these possible options to hurt Ottawa back.

Why 18% GST on life and health insurance is high and must be slashedIndians are paying an 18% GST on term and health insurance premiums, which is higher than what people pay in the US, the UK and South Africa -- a Brics country. This is why experts suggest that the GST Council should bring down tax on insurance premiums.

Rajasthan: The Royal Canvas for Dream WeddingsWhether it's the grandeur of a palace wedding in Udaipur, the mystique of a desert wedding in Jaisalmer, or the creativity of a themed wedding in Jaipur, Rajasthan offers a wedding experience that is truly out of the ordinary.

Gain the skills to drive innovation, lead digital transformations, and position yourself as a visionary in technology leadership.

Nayab Saini's photo with oath event ad out in newspapers before key BJP meetTraditionally, the BJP legislature party meeting finalises the leader's name after deliberation and consensus. However, with Nayab Saini's image and swearing-in details already made public, the announcement seems to be a mere formality.

Gigi and Bella Hadid, Ashley Graham take Victoria's Secret Fashion Show by stormThe 2024 Victoria's Secret Fashion Show returned on October 15, featuring diverse models like Gigi Hadid and Ashley Graham. Highlights included performances by Cher and a focus on inclusivity.

Canadian media slams Trudeau over row with India: Still in 'trust me bro' phaseCanadian media and experts criticised Prime Minister Justin Trudeau for making unsubstantiated allegations against India and allowing Sikh extremism to influence Canada's foreign policy, all without providing credible evidence.

Heavy rain alert in Tamil Nadu, Andhra as depression formed over Bay of Bengal Live UpdatesA well-marked low-pressure area over the southwest and adjoining southeast Bay of Bengal has intensified into a depression and is expected to make landfall between Puducherry and Nellore on October 17, bringing heavy rain in southern states.

Trump turns town hall into 'music fest', makes bizarre remarks on 2 who faintedOn Monday, Trump attended a Town Hall on Monday in Pennsylvania's Oaks suburb moderated by Republican South Dakota Governor Kristi Noem, who faced widespread criticism earlier this year for an incident she mentioned in her book about killing her pet dog.

Qualcomm may still buy Intel but not right nowQualcomm is eyeing to buy Intel, but has decided to wait until the US elections in November. The company is taking its sweet time, and it might stretch to next year.

sports.headline: Virat Kohli's focus on winning games not numbers: Mike Hesson warns AustraliaMike Hesson defended Virat Kohli amid the recent scrutiny over his dipping Test numbers and said that the batter is at that stage of his career where he wants to win games for the team rather than focussing on numbers.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
